message.content: This question requires basic knowledge about the primary source of light on our planet. The sun is the closest star to us and it is responsible for providing light to the Earth. Option (A) is incorrect because the cluster of Orion stars is not the primary source of light for our planet. Option (B) is incorrect because the moon does not produce its own light, it only reflects the light of the sun. Option (D) is incorrect because meteorites flying by do not produce light.

This question requires basic knowledge about the primary source of light on Earth. The closest star to us is the sun, and it serves as the primary source of light for our planet. Option (A) is incorrect because the cluster of Orion stars refers to a group of stars and not a singular source. Option (B) is incorrect because the moon reflects the sun's light, but it is not the primary source itself. Option (D) is incorrect because meteorites do not emit light; they are merely fragments of celestial bodies that burn up upon entering Earth's atmosphere.

Option (D) is incorrect because meteorites flying by do not emit light that illuminates our planet.
